Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the consequences of touching a phone while driving by stating that licenses will be revoked, when in reality, the punishment is a fine.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or official sources to back up the assertion that licenses will be revoked.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the revocation of licenses for touching a phone while driving is a new law passed in Parliament, when in fact, it is already illegal nationwide in Australia.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no law mandating license revocation for drivers caught touching their phone illegally in any Australian state or territory.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the claim may be based on a misunderstanding or misinterpretation of existing laws and regulations regarding phone use while driving in Australia.
